questions.question: What is the difference between a directed and undirected graph?
options: Directed graphs have weights, undirected don't
Directed graphs have edges with direction, undirected have bidirectional edges
Directed graphs can't have cycles
Undirected graphs can't have self-loops
questions.correctAnswer: Directed graphs have edges with direction, undirected have bidirectional edges
questions.explanation: In a directed graph (digraph), edges have a direction indicating one-way relationships between vertices. In an undirected graph, edges represent two-way relationships, meaning if vertex A is connected to B, then B is also connected to A.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of edges in an undirected graph with n vertices?
options: n
questions.explanation: In an undirected graph with n vertices, each vertex can connect to at most n-1 other vertices. Since each edge connects two vertices and we count each edge only once, the maximum number of edges is n(n-1)/2.

questions.question: What is a spanning tree of a graph?
options: A tree that contains all vertices but minimum possible edges
Any subgraph that is a tree
A tree with exactly n-1 edges
A complete binary tree representation of the graph
questions.correctAnswer: A tree that contains all vertices but minimum possible edges
questions.explanation: A spanning tree is a subgraph that includes all vertices of the original graph and forms a tree (no cycles). It contains exactly n-1 edges where n is the number of vertices, which is the minimum needed to keep all vertices connected.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of BFS (Breadth-First Search) in a graph?
options: O(V)
O(E)
O(V + E)
O(V * E)
questions.explanation: BFS visits each vertex once (O(V)) and explores each edge once (O(E)). The total time complexity is O(V + E) where V is the number of vertices and E is the number of edges in the graph.

questions.question: What is an adjacency matrix representation of a graph?
options: A list of all edges in the graph
A 2D array where cell [i][j] indicates if vertices i and j are connected
A tree showing the hierarchy of vertices
A list of vertices with their degrees
questions.correctAnswer: A 2D array where cell [i][j] indicates if vertices i and j are connected
questions.explanation: An adjacency matrix is a square matrix of size V×V where V is the number of vertices. Entry [i][j] is 1 (or the edge weight) if there's an edge from vertex i to j, and 0 otherwise. It provides O(1) edge lookup but requires O(V²) space.
